AuthProviders.Name: Default
AuthProviders.Description: The default authentication method configured by the application.

AuthProviders.Name: SMSOTP
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication using a One-Time Password (OTP) sent via SMS.

AuthProviders.Name: MAILOTP
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication using a One-Time Password (OTP) sent via email.

AuthProviders.Name: Facebook
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through Facebook OAuth2.0 login system.

AuthProviders.Name: Google
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through Google OAuth2.0 login system.

AuthProviders.Name: LinkedIn
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through LinkedIn OAuth2.0 login system.

AuthProviders.Name: Microsoft
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through Microsoft OAuth2.0 login system, including Azure AD and personal accounts.

AuthProviders.Name: Twitter
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through Twitter OAuth2.0 login system (current version).

AuthProviders.Name: TwitterV1
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through Twitter legacy version 1 OAuth2.0 login system.

AuthProviders.Name: Yahoo
AuthProviders.Description: Authentication through Yahoo OAuth2.0 login system.

ClientTypes.Name: Confidential
ClientTypes.Description: Used for applications that securely handle sensitive information and require client authentication, such as server-to-server communication.

ClientTypes.Name: Public
ClientTypes.Description: Used for applications that do not handle sensitive information and do not require client authentication, such as single-page or mobile applications.

FieldEntities.Name: Apps
FieldEntities.Description: Fields related to app-level metadata or settings

FieldEntities.Name: Users
FieldEntities.Description: Fields related to user-level metadata or settings

Roles.Name: Root
Roles.Description: The highest level role with full access to all system resources and configurations.

Roles.Name: Default
Roles.Description: A standard role with basic access permissions suitable for regular users.
